data.title: SfxCompareProvider fix
data.body: This fixes the sfxCompareProvider function in Full and Empty templates to prefer in the following order: FMOD > OpenAL > XAudio > DirectSound

data.title: Release 3.8
data.body: Merge changes for the 3.8 release

data.title: containerRayCast 'misses' physicsShape objects
cuts the shadergen hashkey generator down from a 64 bit to a 32 bit key.
data.body: (MacOSX 32 bit compatibilty errors. was generating 2k+ shader files. may also address  https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1219)

data.title: Terrain collision doesn't work after square size change
data.body:
Hello guys.

Lately I was experimenting with terrain sizes. After I change square size to something higher than '1', terrain collisions stop working correctly. It looks like terrain collision mesh isn't recalculated to new terrain size or something. So if I am moving my player towards the terrain he eventually falls off the ground. Below you can find screen with player collision debug turned on:

![torque3d_terrain_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/606711/10120227/d4d50468-64b1-11e5-9bdc-0c38a27da7b6.jpg)

You can see pink wireframes of collision mesh for player. Player is facing the right side of the screen. As you can see, collision mesh is no longer calculated in front of him, so if I move it further he will fall down.

I checked and this seems to appear in Torque 3.8 RC and 3.7 also.

I'm running Windows 10
ATI Radeon 6850

data.title: Templates sfx autodetect fix
data.body: %providerA in sfxCompareProvider function is a vector instead of the first field. This fixes that and prevents defaulting to Null SFX Provider.

data.title: Changed order of fmodex library unload.
data.body:
This solves a crash i have personally had under multiple reinstalls of my OS, happened with windows 7, 8.1 and 10. When unloading the fmodex.dll it crashes on Win32DLibrary::close(). I have never been able to reproduce this bug on another computer though :/ . I have even tried a clean re-install disabling my on-board sound in the bios and using a pcie creative card and same thing happens so it's not a sound card driver.

Only thing that solved it was swapping the order that fmod_event and fmodex was dereferenced thus causing the dll to be unloaded.

data.title: SDL Menubar accelerator fix
data.body: Fixes it so when using SDL, the editor menubar will correctly react to accelerator commands.

data.title: ipv6 support
data.body:
Problem: Torque3D does not support ipv6.

Considering the global exhaustion of ipv4 addresses, and the increasing likelihood of future networks actually moving to ipv6, it makes sense for torque to support ipv6 in the networking stack. From what I gather this requires changing argument types and factoring in ipv6 addresses.

data.title: CMake NMake fix to place exe in game directory
data.body: This fixes CMake NMake build generation to place the exe in the game directory

data.title: CMAKE duplicates
data.body:
Some cmake code is duplicated in Torque3D.cmake haven't checked other files yet.

https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Tools/CMake/torque3d.cmake#L542-L558
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Tools/CMake/torque3d.cmake#L626-L643 <- freetype

data.title: mQuat.h change to fix QuatF::angleBetween
data.body:
The old version doesn't have that 2.0f in the return that seems to be needed.
Also added normalizing inside so it can be used directly for not-normalized quaternions too.

data.title: remove GL_EXT_gpu_shader4
data.body: addresses issue #1417

data.title: [OpenGL] Remove GL_EXT_GPU_Shader4
data.body:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gfx/gl/gfxGLShader.cpp#L955-L960

This is now part of the OpenGL core profile. Needs to be removed, as that's prior to the core profile to use that extension.

data.title: SDL Textbox bleedthrough inputs fix
data.body: Corrects input issues when typing into text fields and it bleeding through to player inputs.

data.title: partial reversion for #1333
data.body: To be honest, can't remember how I was intending to fix that, but this one's causing it to fail to profile twice in a row, so kill it with fire.

data.title: ObjectName-InternalName potential conflicts
data.body:
Looks like there's no error or warning if you assign an internalName to an object in the same heirarchy as an object with an objectName of the same value, which could lead to unpredictable behavior.

When assigning one or the other, should have it check that there's no parent/child control that shares the name in either field, so that no wires get crossed inadvertently.

data.title: void GuiTextEditCtrl::execConsoleCallback() reversion
data.body: see https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1408

data.title: Light animation brightness fix
data.body: Corrects light animation to adhere to the brightness level set in the light's params instead of sticking with the default 0-1 brightness range.

data.title: U32 MRandomLCG::randI() was using longs
data.body: 32 and 64 bit windows can handle that. 64 bit linux no likey mixing longs and ints.

data.title: GuiControl::setVariable(const char *value) unable to take type
data.body:
Recently rolled in https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/commit/77b9600303ac952cd3a5153ce2cbf5809d5034b3#diff-e4ea6d75e6c53e52a5cc5049e7cd21ae

Broke an old code-share http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/38929/1#comment-303162

potential resolutions:
1) revert back to
   if ( mConsoleVariable[0] )
      Con::setVariable(mConsoleVariable, mTextBuffer.getPtr8());
2) add a StringBuffer flag defaulting to non-formated.
3) a brighter idea.

data.title: SDL2 + Fullscreen + Resolution Change = Mangle
data.body:
Would do a screenshot, but ctrl+print saves off the the last pre-resized frame, and alt+tab 'fixes' it.

Simplest repro steps: options->fullscreen->change res low to high->note cut out areas of the screen.
